items.name: Ernest
items.desc:
The English Pale: Ernest (4.0%): Originally rejected due to its 'strong, coarse, American aroma', Ernest was bred by Ernest Salmon in 1923. Its "New World" flavour profile of apricot, citrus and spice was not desirable at the time, and it was deemed a poor substitute for the control hop of the trials, Fuggles. In the context of today's brewing, these bold, fruity flavours are more at home, and Ernest could yet prove itself as a valuable addition to the contemporary brewing world.
The English Pale series is designed to showcase new English hops. The folks at Yakima Chief Hops have supplied us with Ernest and Endeavour hops before they are released for general sale.
Each beer focuses on a different hop and is brewed using the same simple malt bill and clean yeast strain. The beer is custom-designed to allow the unique character of each hop to shine through. These are 440ml cans.
Christmas gift-wrapping is available!

items.name: The Cream Ale
items.desc: The Cream Ale (4.5%) - An American style, from the pre-prohibition era, remastered for London today. The Cream Ale, brewed exclusively with Loral hops, delivers floral, herbal and bright citrus aromas. It gets its name and its smooth character from the use of flaked corn and oats. All of this combines to create an easy drinking, refreshing beer.

items.name: The IPA
items.desc:
The IPA (6.0%) - India Pale Ales were born in 18th century Britain. The style has since been on a journey of development and diversification. Our IPA is inspired by those from the West Coast of America. Brewed in London with British malt and American hops (Summit, Ekuanot & Enigma), it is dank, resinous and fruit forward. Store cold and drink fresh. These are 440ml cans.
Christmas gift-wrapping is available!

items.name: The Imperial Coffee & Cocoa Stout
items.desc:
Our last release of 2020, The Imperial Coffee & Cocoa Stout is a bold marriage of some of life’s greatest pleasures. Ethiopian coffee brings a gentle roast, along with smooth chocolate and subtle fruit aromas. Special, husk-less roasted malts in the mash keep the overall roasted levels in check, whilst Cocoa nibs add a silky texture along with more chocolate notes.
A rich, warming, rewarding stout, perfect for bringing the year to a close. Drink fresh, or age indefinitely. These are 440ml cans.
Dispatches Tuesday 15th December!

items.name: The Lager
items.desc:
The Lager (4.7%) - Inspired by the Helles Lagerbiers of Munich, this is a true London Lager. German malts, European hops and London water come together to produce a smooth, crisp and flavourful beer. In the spirit of Das Reinheitsgebot, we use the spunding method to carbonate our lager naturally; while an extended cold storage in Lager tanks gives our beer time to condition and mature as all true lagers must. These are 440ml cans.
Christmas gift-wrapping is available!

items.name: The Ordinary Bitter
items.desc:
The Ordinary Bitter (3.7%) - The original session beer, Ordinary Bitters formed a cornerstone of English drinking culture. Perfectly balanced between malt sweetness and hop bitterness, our interpretation is brought up to date with the use of US Chinook hops. Delicate hop aromas of pine, spice and dark fruits are followed by a smooth, full bodied palate with notes of biscuit and caramel. Brewed with EKG and Chinook. These are 440ml cans.
Christmas gift-wrapping is available!

items.name: The Pale Ale
items.desc:
The Pale Ale (4.4%) - Pale Ales are the mainstay of today’s craft brewing scene, but they date back to the 1700s, when innovation led to the production of new and paler malts. Our interpretation brings the style bang up to date, pairing a crisp malt base with fresh American hops. Light, bright & fruity, The Pale Ale is our ultimate drinking beer. Brewed with Citra, Mosaic and Simcoe. These are 440ml cans.
Christmas gift-wrapping is available!

items.name: The Porter
items.desc:
The beer that started it all.
The Porter (6.7%) - The Porter is our flagship beer. The style established Victorian London as the centre of the brewing world. The Porter is also the beer that started us on our journey. Our blend of highly kilned and roasted malts is suited perfectly to our water, producing balanced flavours of rich coffee and dark chocolate. This award-winning Porter represents the true beer style of London. It is one that we are incredibly proud of. These are 440ml cans.
Christmas gift-wrapping is available!

items.name: The Sloe & Juniper Sour
items.desc: A festive fruit sour showcasing the classic pairing of juniper and sloe berries. A whirlpool addition of juniper imparts a gentle botanical aroma and pairs perfectly with the soft, fruity plumbiness of the sloe juice. A simple malt base of Maris Otter and wheat allow the berries shine through, whilst a fresh acidity balances the sweetness, leading to a bright, fresh finish. These are 440ml cans.

items.name: The Sour Dry Hop
items.desc:
The Sour Dry Hop (4.9%) - The Sour Dry Hop is the perfect balance of Old and New World brewing. Inspired by the traditional Berliner Weisse, a sour beer once brewed in Berlin and known as the 'Champagne of the North'. Ours is soured by Lactobacillus and dry-hopped with Citra. An unusual style that delivers a tart, citrusy fruitiness. These are 440ml cans.
Christmas gift-wrapping is available! Dispatched Monday 16th November.

items.name: The Table Beer
items.desc: The Table Beer (2.7%) - A blend of Jester and H. Blanc hops in the kettle and the dry hop give flavours of lemon, lychee and a touch of spice. German ale yeast and pilsner malt lend a clean, crisp character to the beer, whilst the low ABV keeps it light, fresh and effortlessly drinkable. These are 440ml cans.
